oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ongoing research of Rhizoctonia
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kari, Maarit
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Main goals of study on Rhizoctonia were: to describe the way of infection in different stages, to identify and characterize Rhizoctonia races, to study infection-induced changes in the gene expression of R. solani and potato, and to determine the relative importance of infested seed, soil qualities and variety to the disease development.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kari, Maarit (2006) Ongoing research of Rhizoctonia. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 2 (1), p. 24.
